fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45328].
  {panel}

Here's a fairly obtuse bug:

# Start a new, clean search
# Add two issue types to the search where one of them isn't available in all projects (e.g., in the QA data, choose "Book Request" and "Bug")
# Now, choose a project where one of those issue types isn't present and there are no matching issues (no such project exists by default in the QA data; create a new empty project)
# Save the filter
# Create a new issue in that project
# Refresh the filter

Issues won't appear in the detail view. If you click through to the List View, the issue will appear, then if you click back to the Detail view, they will.

Weirdly finnicky. Not sure if my steps are accurate enough.
fields.summary: Odd behaviour with saved filters
"View Watchers" broken with long list

h5. Summary
Currently, on the Create screen, the project field gets pre-populated with the project that was last accessed.

h5. Suggestion
As a JIRA user, it would more convenient in dealing with multiple projects, different ones on separate browser windows/tabs, when clicking on the Create button the Project field gets pre-populated with the project that is associated with the page/url where the click occurred.
Please consider implementing this change or make it an optional config that can be easily turned on/off.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an attachment is removed from an issue, the internal <JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments/ folder does not delete the created thumbnail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Attach an image to it (More > Attach Files or Attach Screenshot)
# Delete the attachment (click the trash icon at the thumbnail)

h3. Expected Results
All the content from that attachment is removed from <JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments/<ISSUE_KEY> folder

h3. Actual Results
The image thumbnail remains in the <JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments/<ISSUE_KEY>/thumb folder


h3.Workaround
Manually remove the <JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments/<ISSUE_KEY>/thumb/_thumb_<XYZ>.png thumbnail file if there is no <XYZ> file at <JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments/<ISSUE_KEY>/ folder.
fields.summary: Deleting an attachment does not remove its thumbnail from the filesystem

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45301].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today in the https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue-level+Security documentation, there is nothing saying the project will assume its permissions in case you don't set an Issue Security to it. Also, the information appearing there can lead the user to think that all issues are available for anyone:

!issue_security.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an extra information in our documentation mentioning the Project Permission will be considered in case there is no Issue Security set to it.
This information in the Issue Security screen would be great as well.
fields.summary: Add an extra information in the Issue Security documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45300].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today, when we don't have an Issue Security enabled in a project, the it shows the "Anyone" text on the top:

!issue_security.png|thumbnail!

And since there is no Issue Security, the permissions to access the project/issues will be defined by the project's permissions.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can change this message (or add a more detailed information), since it can lead the users to think that anyone has access to the issues from that specific project.
fields.summary: Change Issue Security Information
Warning notifcation when creating a clone ticket

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Create a new ticket as an administrator in a project with existing components.

Inside the component field, type in, or fat-finger a component so that it would generate a new component.  Remove the component to the ticket, and associate a legitimate component.

Submit the ticket for creation.

The modal popup notifying you of the creation of a ticket will notify you that you have created a new component which in fact *did not happen*.  You can validate by navigating to the project administration tab for components, and the component would not have been created.

The screen should properly notify you only in a new component was created.
fields.summary: Dynamic Component UI Modal Bug

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h2.Summary
Project Picker custom fields are not working in Issue Navigator search. When clicking on the drop down list; the list is empty and when attempting to click on the empty list; error is returned.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a new custom field of type Project Picker
# Create a new issue stating some value to the custom field
# Include the new custom field to the Issue Navigator JQL search
# Try to specify the value for the field.

h2.Expected Result
* List of projects returned.

h2.Current Result
* No project is returned. Only a long white list and when you attempt to click on the white list, it shows no project name as the screenshot below:

!first.jpg|thumbnail!

!second.JPG|thumbnail!

h2. Workaround

Using Advance Searching instead. 
{code}
"Project Picker Custom Field Name" = <Project Name>
{code}

h2. Addition Observation

When switching to Advance Search, defined the Project for the search and returns to Basic Search, it is seen to have some weird values on the values field, {{$valueObject.getString('name')}}

!Screen Shot 2015-09-28 at 4.19.42 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project Picker custom field not working in Issue Navigator search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45296].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
If a user sends an email to JIRA and the email contains an inline attachment, the file is attached as an attachment rather than being a part of the main comment from the email.

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Create a project in JIRA
* Configure incoming email for the project
* Send an email that contains an inline image to the project so it creates an issue.

*Expected Result*
File appears as it is with the email that was sent.

*Actual Result*
File is added as an attachment to the issue rather than being part of the comment(embedded in the comment).

*Current Way it Works*
If the user adds the correct wiki markup for image in the email, the image is attached in the comment correctly.

*Suggested solution*
JIRA should scan the email and should it notice an attachment in the incoming mail, replace the section with the email with an appropriate wiki Markup.
fields.summary: Allow Inline Attachments from Incoming Email appear in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Email notification is sent to user who is assigned  to an issue using post function although the fire event is not associated to any email ( user or group ) . 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dummy event ( No eMail)
!event1.png|thumbnail!
#  Create a new Notification scheme and only configure the following :
!event2.png|thumbnail!
# Associate that notification scheme to the project. 
# Edit the project's workflow to have a looped transition back to the same state, add a post function event for *Update Issue Field* and then Select the Assignee field to be assigned with a user (Test)  then click Add.
!event3.png|thumbnail!
# Edit the *Fire a Generic Event event that can be processed by the listeners.* with the new event created earlier (No eMail)
!event4.png|thumbnail!
# Publish the workflow.
# Create an issue without an assignee
!event6.png|thumbnail!
# Transition the issue to the same state and the issue will be assigned to the user configured in the post function ( Test ).

h3. Expected Results
* Email notificaiton is not supposed to be sent to the assignee ( Test ) as the post workflow is not firing the issue assignee notification but a dummy event ( No eMail )

h3. Actual Results
* Email notification is sent to the assignee ( test )
!event8.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
The expectation from previous version 5.2.11 is NOT to receive an email since the event "No eMail" hasn't any recipients in the notification scheme. This event was created  to make sure there are no emails sent during the transition.

h3. Workaround 
* Remove the notification of Current Assignee for Issue Assigned (System) for the project's notification scheme. This will completely prevent the Issues Assigned notification from being fired.
* Instead of using Current Assignee for the Issue Assigned (System) notification, you can associated it to a Group. You can associate members who you want to receive notification if they are assigned to an issue. If the user is not in that group, the user will not receive any notification when assigned to an issue.
fields.summary: Fire event in post function for notification is not respected when issue transitions

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45269].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
In JIRA, if a user is created and the option to send a notification to such a user is not checked, it would be difficult to notify the user again.

*Usage Scenario*
- Go to {{Admin > User Management}} page.
- Click Create User.
- Do not check the option to {{Send Notification Email}}.
- Create the user.

Now decide to send a notification to the user so they know an account has been created for them.

*Option 1*
- Delete the user.
- Create user again and check the option.

*Option 2*
- Send a personal email to the user and have the user reclaim their username and password using the feature {{Can't access your account?}}

*Preferred Solution*
- Add the option to {{Send Notification Email}} to the modify user feature.
fields.summary: Send Notification to already created users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45256].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary
When a project is deleted in JIRA, various configurations as well as users remain in it hence achieving a full clean delete is difficult.

For example, if I restore a backup but require just one project, if I delete all the other projects, settings such as permission scheme, configuration scheme, Workflows and users are still left in the system.

The feature we would like implemented would be able to delete all of these when the project is deleted.

*Suggestion*:
As most schemes can be shared, a notification should be shown when user attempts to delete a project that has such a shared scheme and the user would be allowed to confirm this.
If they confirm it, revert all such settings back to the default schemes for them.
fields.summary: Allow full project delete.

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

User couldn't search a user with email address as their username via Issue Navigator. For example, user A trying to search user B through *assignee* column in basic search but its shows _"No Matches"_ error message.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user B with email address as their username for example !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a user A.
# Login as admin and do this:
#* Don't grant user A a *Browse Users* global permission.
#* Grant user A an *Assign Issue* permission.
#* Grant user B an *Assignable User* permission.
# Login as user A and try to search user B as per the screenshot below:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results.

Other users should be able to search the user with full name.

h3. Actual Results.

Basic search shows "No Matches" error message in Assignee column.

h3. Notes

User A do not have the *Browse Users* global permission. What makes user A can search user B is:
# User A is in the *Assign Issue* permission.
# User B is in the *Assignable User* permission.

h3. Workaround

* Key in the whole username for example abc@abc instead of abc.
* Grant user a *Browse User* global permission.
fields.summary: Unable to search user when its using email address as their username

*Summary*
JIRA needs to be able to export 'Versions' only

*Details*
Currently we don't have the feature that could achieve the 'Version' export to any kind of format (excel, etc). One of my customer asked this feature to help him to do some reporting in the company.

*Workaround*
Unfortunately, we do not have any workaround for this moment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45250].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* The default *Order By* for the issue navigator on the Project view page is set to 'Priority' and this cannot be changed. 
* Please refer to the screenshot below on the top right, the Order By is by default set to Priority and even after changing it to something else for example, 'Created' , once the page is refreshed, the Order By will go back to 'Priority' 
!priority.png|thumbnail!
* The problem also occurs in the view "all issues" (the table that comes when clicking the link to view all issues).

h3. Suggested Solution
* Introduce the feature to configure or ability to remember the last used Order By
 
h3. Workaround 
* Create a filter and use the filter instead.
fields.summary: Change the default Order By for issue navigator on project view

*Issue Summary*
Currently, setting/ configuring the "Time Tracking Settings" is a system wide change and all projects use this same setting.

Can this be made to a project level setting as users might at times want to have different Timing Tracking Settings e.g default should be in hours for project A while it is expected in minutes for project B.

_This is with regards to {{Admin > System > Time Tracking}} feature_

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Escaping special characters doesn't work correctly in issue search. It seems they are ignored.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue whose summary is 'fifteen'
# Create an issue whose summary is 'fifteen*'
# Search the second issue with a following keyword {noformat}"fifteen\\*"{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Hits only the second issue. (The one which has a summary 'fifteen*')

h3. Actual Results
Hits both of the issues.
 
h3. Notes
According to [JRA-25092|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25092],
{code}
summary ~ "fifteen\\*" (works)
{code}
but it doesn't look working.

Actually the same behavior is also applied to special characters used in the beginning of the word. If we also create an issue with the summary is '*fifteen' if we search for
{code}
summary ~ "\\*fifteen"
{code}
this search will return all three issues (with summary 'fifteen', '\*fifteen' and 'fifteen\*').
fields.summary: Escaping special characters doesn't work correctly in issue search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45239].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently using SQL logging in *Administration* > *System* > *Troubleshooting and Support* > *Logging and Profiling* does not enable AO logging by default. It must be enabled in addition to SQL logging.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the button so that it enables logging at the same time.
 
h3. Workaround 

Follow [How to Enable Detailed SQL Logging in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Enable+Detailed+SQL+Logging+in+JIRA].
fields.summary: As an Admin I want SQL Logging to enable Active Objects Logging by Default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45236].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When viewing issue, some users(mostly Administrator/Manager) want to know if there is any other issue raised by the same reporter. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of doing a filter for it, there must be a panel on the view issue webpage where it shows all other related issues. 

h3. Workaround 
There is [Scripted Fields|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/scripted-fields.html] in [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner] plugin which will be able to retrive the issue IDs and display on the screen while viewing any issue.
*Note*: This is just a suggestion, never tested before.
fields.summary: Ability to see issue created by the reporter when viewing the issue

fields.description:

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When accessing a dashboard with gadgets that depends on filters that the user does not have access to, the error message is misleading and does not reflect the true nature of the problem:
{quote}*Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above.*
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a private (not shared) filter;
 # Add a *Pie Chart* gadget to a shared Dashboard;
 # Use the private filter on the *Pie Chart* gadget;
 # Access this dashboard as another user.

h3. Expected Results

An error mentioning the user is unable to view the filter or project would be displayed as in JIRA 6.3.15:
!jira6315.png!
h3. Actual Results

The following error is displayed:
!jira6411.png!
h3. Notes
 # The problem is simply that the user viewing the gadget does not have permission to view the filter.
 # The problem will happen if any field values was missing from the filter.

h3. Workaround
 * Note 1: Grant the user the necessary permission to view the filters used by the affected gadgets.
 * Note 2: Remove the missing field values from the filter.
fields.summary: Regression JRA-17411 - Misleading error when accessing Dashboards without permission to see gadgets' filters

fields.description:
When I run the query 'created <= '2015-09-04' it does not include any JIRAs created on 2015-09-04. Less than or equal to is acting like less than, when it should be including the specified date.

When I run the query 'created > '2015-09-03' it is including any JIRAs created on 2015-09-03. Greater than is acting like greater than or equal to, when it should be excluding the specified date.

This is affecting all of our reporting that we run in Jira

h3. Re-Opening this Bug

h3. Summary
* When we run this JQL {{project = <project> AND issuetype in (BUG) AND created >= "2019-10-01" AND created <="2019-10-31"}} it returns 95 issues and,

* {{project = TORF AND issuetype in (TR, BUG) AND created >= "2019-10-01" AND created <"2019-11-01"}} this returns 100 issues.
* Technically both should return the same results but first JQL Filter ignores the issues reported on 31st Oct.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run the JQL to list the issue between dates using the operators as above.

h3. Expected Results
* JQL should list the issues created in between the dates (including those 2 dates) when equal is used with any of those < or > operators.

h3. Actual Results
* Operator *<=* (_Less than or equal to_) skipping the issues created on that date.

h3.Workaround
No
fields.summary: operators <= (Less than or equal to) and > (greater than) are not working properly with dates

h3. Problem Definition
Some users are finding the new 'Add a Gadget' experience in JIRA a little confusing:

* On the initial screen there is an error: "Were still trying to fetch..." rather than "We're still trying to fetch..."
* There is no progress indicator is shown to indicate that JIRA is still loading gadgets
* It's not immediately obvious that the message to the right changes
* It's not clear that the 'load all gadgets' link is a link that needs to be clicked

h3. Suggested Solution
* Fix the error, and display a progress spinner on the initial window
* Make it clearer that the loading process is complete
* Make it clearer that 'load all gadgets' is something that needs to be pressed

h3. Additional Information

* Initial dialog with error, also not showing any loading indicator:
!gadgets-1.png|thumbnail!

* Second diaglog, note it is very similar to the first dialog so it's not immediately clear the text has changed and that it is now necessary to click the link:
!gadgets-2-updated.png|thumbnail!

* Final resulting dialog with all gadgets loaded
!gadgets-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The new Add a Gadget experience in JIRA is a little confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45211].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

During bulk operations that change a field, sometime we want to keep the current field value if it meets certain criteria.  For a group of issues where we provide a new value for a field, we want to only change the field value if it does not already meet the field criteria.

Example: In a collection of issues some are Resolved with a value for Resolution.  Others in the collection are not yet resolved.  We want to change all the issues statuses to Resolved but only change the Resolution if it has not already been populated.

h3. Suggested Solution

When entering new field values for the bulk operation, provide an optional text input where a JQL expression can be entered.  Issues that match this JQL filter will receive the new field value, otherwise the existing field value will not be modified.
 
h3. Workaround 

Split the result collection into two or more groups using JQL queries.  Perform the desired changes on each of these smaller groups of issues as appropriate.
fields.summary: Ability to conditionally update field values during bulk operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45210].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If you set a group to have a project permission, Permission Helper says that the user do not have the project permission, but the user do have the permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new user 
# Create a new group 
# Create a new project
# Create a new issue
# Make sure the user belongs only to the new group and jira-users.
# Add the group to have the project permission "Browse Project".
# Open the Project Roles and remove the group jira-users of the Project Role users.
#* This is to make sure that the user is only given permission through groups not project roles.
# Open the permission helper and inform the user and issue that you just created.
#  Select "Browse Projects" and Submit

h3. Expected Results

The permission helper correctly identifies the user is in that group and that they belong to that project permission, and they have permissions.

h3. Actual Results

Permission helper says "The user do not have 'Browse Project' permission".

h3. Workaround

Set the permission to project roles instead of groups or user. We highly recommend project roles are used over groups for permissions as it means one permission scheme can be applied to multiple projects.
fields.summary: Permission Helper does not recognize groups or single users in Project Permissions

fields.description:
(i)This applies for following REST methods:
{noformat}
- /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog
- /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog/{id}
- /rest/api/2/search
- /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}
{noformat}

(i) Steps to reproduce:

1) Create JIRA user with username "user1". Please see [^01 user1 details.png].

2) Put some work logs under the newly created user. Please see [^02 user1 work logs.png].

3) [^03 user1 work logs json.png] shows that /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog returns correct info.

4) Rename username to "user1-renamed". [^04 renamed user1 user1-renamed.png].

5) Create new user with username "user1". Please see [^05 new user1 details.png].

6) /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog states that worklogs from Step 2 belong to the new user created on Step 5. Please see [^06 work logs json returning wrong user.png]. The Work Log comment tab shows correct worklogs association.

We reproduced this in JIRA 6.4 and 6.4.6 but I guess the same bug exists in all JIRA versions starting from 6.1 since the usernames renaming was introduced.

Attached is JIRA 6.4 hsql database.
fields.summary: JIRA REST API methods return wrong worklogs users belonging after creating user with username that mathes username of previously renamed user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Filter auto-complete fails after dash character

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Just create 3 filters named z-filter1, z-filter2, z-filter3. (If you can't reproduce with just these filters add 20 more).
# Add a pie chart gadget (or any other gadget with filter option) to your dashboard and try to add one of these filters
# When you type *z*, it will list all the z filters
# when you continue typing *z-f*

h3. Expected Results
The filter should suggest all filters with *z-f*

h3. Actual Results
The auto complete fails after the dash, either by showing nothing at all or only showing some filters instead all that meet that string till the dash character. Check the video attached for the reproduction. !actual.mp4!
 
h3. Notes
* You should have *multiple filters with the same initial start before the dash*, if you want to reproduce it. Eg: good-day, good-day1, good-day2
* This happens in the gadgets filter configuration.
* Check the video attached
* This was reproducible in JIRA 6.4.11
* I *was not* able to reproduce this in JIRA 6.4.6
fields.summary: Filter autocomplete fails after dash character

fields.description:
When attachment contain strike-through on the file name it will be shown broken on the Email conversation.

*Work around*
The root cause of this is botocss library and jsoup library. The jsoup library (current 1.7.2) is not compatible with <del> tag for strike through
If updating jsoup to 1.8 in botocss, and updating botocss in JIRA, the problem is solved.

h3.Diagnosis

The problem can be confirmed running the query below against the JIRA database. If the problem exists, the query will not bring any results
{code:sql}
select * from propertyentry where property_key like '%License20%'
{code}

h3.Resolution

Import the backup again, informing a server license in the *License* field (see screenshot below)
!licensefield.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
If re-import the backup is not possible (which would be the case if the instance is already being used for a while and already has data differing from the backup), you can update the license details directly in the database, following the instructions in the [500 error page when logging with a JIRA administrator user after restore a backup from Cloud in a Server instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/500+error+page+when+logging+with+a+JIRA+administrator+user+after+restore+a+backup+from+Cloud+in+a+Server+instance] article.
fields.summary: 500 error page when logging with a JIRA sys administrator user after restore a backup from Cloud in a Server instance
Option to change the default code macro to a different value than java

fields.description:
+Summary:+ A JIRA issue that is linked to a Confluence page will trigger an update time stamp on the JIRA ticket. Also will log a Remote Link event to be listed on the All tab. 

The behavior was noticed on a meeting notes page with multiple JIRA issues linked. Each meeting causes all of the JIRA issues to be updated and a new Remote Link event to be logged.

+How to Reproduce:+
# Link a JIRA issue to a Confluence page.
# Make any kind of edit to the Confluence page.

+Expected Results:+
The JIRA issue "Updated" time stamp to no be changed. The No generic Remote Link event to be logged on the JIRA issue.

+Actual Results:+ 
The Updated time stamp on the JIRA issue will be now and a new "Remote Link" generic event will be logged.

Similar to JRA-43280.
fields.summary: All updates on a linked Confluence page causes the JIRA issue to be updated and a change history entry
Workflow automation via issue event as triggers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45180].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The release date can be set when administrators create a version. But this date will be overwritten with the actual release date when the version is released.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have another field called 'planned release date' so that administrators can keep track of how many days we are early or late for the release.
fields.summary: Planned version release date

fields.description:
This question is about the atlassian JIRA plugin development. When I use event listener to handle JIRA's IssueEvent of comment deleted event, I can catch the comment deleted event with event type "com.atlassian.jira.event.type.EventType.ISSUE_COMMENT_DELETED_ID". But I don't know how can I get the comment id which has been deleted in this event. I've tried the IssueEvent.getComment for this situation, but it returns null. 
BTW, I've tried the change log way to get the comment body of deleted from the change log, but the comment id is still missing and I don't know where to get it.
fields.summary: Cannot get deleted comment id from JIRA's IssueEvent with type ISSUE_COMMENT_DELETED_ID

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Project view page loading is very slow with million issues, 2,500 projects and 1,500 boards. In this specific bug report, this is due to the Project Versions not being cached. Instances with large number of *Versions* are affected, example: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Versions: 12416
Versions: 19755
Versions: 16263
{code}

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.5 
* JIRA Agile 6.7.6
* MySQL 5.6.x

h3. Expected Results
Faster project view page loading less than 130 seconds (at least a half of the current result).

h3. Actual Results
Actual project view page loading is around 130 seconds.

h3. Verification

Taking thread dumps as per [Generate a Thread Dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Generating+a+Thread+Dump] during problematic periods of slowness, and searching for the below stack traces can indicate this is a problem:

{noformat}

	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4834)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache$DelegatingLoadingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:316)
	at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.CachingVersionStore.getVersionsByName(CachingVersionStore.java:148)

	at scala.Option.flatMap(Option.scala:170)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.fields.helpers.GenericClauseInputMapper$class.apply(GenericClauseInputMapper.scala:12)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.fields.FixVersionJQLInputMapper.apply(FixVersionJQLInputMapper.scala:10)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.InputParamsBuilder$$anonfun$mapEntry$1.applyOrElse(InputParamsBuilder.scala:106)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.InputParamsBuilder$$anonfun$mapEntry$1.applyOrElse(InputParamsBuilder.scala:105)
	at scala.runtime.AbstractPartialFunction.apply(AbstractPartialFunction.scala:33)
	at scala.Option.collect(Option.scala:250)
	....
{noformat}

The stack trace may differ given the version and also database used - the specific class to look for is {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.getContext(AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.java:27)}}.

h3. Notes
There is a possible bottleneck when user tries to open the project view page. And it is related to Project Versions. Basically when JIRA fetches project versions it makes subsequent calls to DB for each version and selects all values from the table (no cache), after that it iterates through selected version values and filters them. It could be a problem when JIRA has more than a million issues, 2,500 projects and 1,500 boards.

h3.Workaround
Use the following steps below. 
# Disable the {{board-scope-filter}} module in JIRA Agile Add-on ({{board-scope-filter}} module tells the sidebar the list of boards to show on the board dropdown as well as the board that is currently selected.).
## Navigate through Administration menu > Add-ons > Manage Add-ons > Select 'JIRA Agile'
## Expand the JIRA Agile Add-on modules
## Find the 'board-scope-filter' module and disable it.
# Disable Project Navigation (Sidebar project navigation) for all users: Administration Menu > System > Project Navigation
fields.summary: Agile view in project sidebar - Project Versions not being cached

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45177].
  {panel}

In JIRA 7.X Server and Cloud, the images that come pre-appended by JIRA in the email are of type SVG which unfortunately is not supported by Gmail anymore.

Owing to the fact that a large number of our users use Gmail, can this be fixed.

This has been reported [here|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20815613/svg-images-blocked-by-gmail-proxy].

Also, this affects mails from Service Desk
fields.summary: Email Image attachments do not work in Gmail
Provide the option to disable automatic creation of Components

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45175].
  {panel}

In Jira if you close an issue you can no longer edit it; that makes perfect sense.  However, you also can't add labels to it, which makes it impossible to any kind of analysis of tickets after the fact (eg. to label the bugs found in productions differently from bugs found by QA).  Furthermore, even if the issue isn't closed, you have to go in to the issue, and then open a drop-down just to add a label.

It'd be great if:
A) you could add labels to closed issues (or at least make it an option)
B) add labels more easily on the issue page, without needing the drop-down
C) add labels from the issue list page
fields.summary: Label Improvements: Easier Adding, Allow Adding to Closed Issues, Allow Adding From Issues List
As an Admin, I would like to turn off pop-up tips in JIRA
Ability to edit Label Custom field options
